circumstances: After takeoff from Miami-Intl Airport, while climbing to a height of 100 feet, the left engine failed. The pilot stopped climbing and was attempting to land on the remaining wet runway when the airplane banked left, causing the left wing to drop and to struck the runway surface. Upon impact, the left main gear was torn off. The airplane went out of control, crash landed and came to rest. All 33 occupants were evacuated safely while the aircraft was damaged beyond repair.
probable_cause:
Engine failure during initial climb due to inadequate maintenance and inspection. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Failure of a cylinder assembly (disconnected), 
- Failed to maintain flying speed, 
- Delayed action in aborting takeoff, 
- Improper emergency procedures, 
- Low ceiling, 
- Rain,
- Pilot stopped climbing and was attempting to land on the remaining wet runway.
